text.section: The State Fire Marshal, a designee of the State Fire Marshal, a full-time fire investigator who is a member of a fire department, or a police officer may apply to a judge of the District Court or a circuit court for an administrative search warrant to enter a vehicle, building, or premises where a fire has occurred to conduct a search to determine the cause and origin of the fire.

An application under subsection (a) of this section shall:
be in writing;
be signed and sworn to by the applicant; and
particularly describe the vehicle, building, or premises to be searched and the nature, scope, and purpose of the search to be performed by the applicant.

section.section: An administrative search warrant issued under this section shall specify the vehicle, building, or premises to be searched.
The search conducted may not exceed the limits specified in the warrant.

text.section:
An administrative search warrant issued under this section shall be executed and returned to the judge who issued it within:
the time specified in the warrant, not exceeding 30 days; or
if no time period is specified in the warrant, 15 days after its issuance.
